thread.title: Lady Bulldogs move to 7-0 in BDC
thread.title_full: Lady Bulldogs move to 7-0 in BDC

title: Lady Bulldogs move to 7-0 in BDC
text: Lady Bulldogs move to 7-0 in BDC Comment The Carmi Times - Carmi, IL Writer Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 9:00 AM Updated at 9:48 AM Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 9:00 AM Updated at 9:48 AM MCLEANSBORO - The CWC Lady Bulldogs found success in a gym where Carmi teams often have trouble with a 25-17, 25-21 win at Hamilton County on Tuesday in BDC Volleyball action. CWC was dominant early leading 6-0 and 10-2, many of the points coming off Peighton Parksâ€™ serves. The Lady Bulldogs kept up the pressure on, building the lead to 23-11 in front of a cheering group of Carmi fans that made the trip, including a mini version of the Maroon Platoon that showed up. A late rally by the Lady Foxes closed the score to 23-17 before a pair of blocks from Lixi Wheeler sealed the game for the Lady Bulldogs. In Game 2 a couple of early kills from Wheeler and an ace from Paige Winter led CWC to a 10-7 lead. They stretched the lead to 15-11 before Hamilton County came surging back to take a 17-16 lead and causing CWC Coach Penny Gunter to call a timeout. Several effective serves from Kaylea Chappelle put the Lady Bulldogs back in front 20-17. Match point came on a serve from Hamilton County that was dug by Carrie Blankenberger, set by Maggi Ackerman and killed by Wheeler. Earlier, The Lady Bulldog JV squad suffered their first defeat of the year falling 25-19, 15-25, 14-16. The Carmi Times - Carmi, IL Writer Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 9:00 AM Updated at 9:48 AM
